title: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Learn fundamental concepts of data structures and algorithms with hands-on practice.

chapters.title: Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms

questions.question: Which traversal technique visits the left subtree, the root, and then the right subtree?

In which traversal does the root get visited last?

questions.question: What is an undirected graph?
options: A graph where edges have no direction
A graph where edges have a specific direction
A graph where all nodes are connected
questions.correctAnswer: A graph where edges have no direction

questions.question: Which graph representation uses a 2D array to store edge information?
What is the space complexity of an adjacency list for a graph with V vertices and E edges?

Which of the following algorithms finds the shortest path in a weighted graph?
What is the time complexity of BFS in a graph with V vertices and E edges?
Which property holds true for a binary search tree?
Which traversal technique is used to get a sorted order of elements in a binary search tree?
Which algorithm is used to find the minimum spanning tree of a graph?

modules.title: Introduction to Sorting Algorithms
modules.content: Learn the basics of sorting algorithms, their classifications, and time/space complexity.

questions.question: Which of the following is a stable sorting algorithm?

modules.content: Explore sorting algorithms that use the divide-and-conquer approach, including Merge Sort and Quick Sort.

questions.question: Which algorithm divides the array into two halves and merges them after sorting?

modules.title: Introduction to Searching Algorithms
modules.content: Learn the fundamental concepts of searching algorithms, including linear and binary search.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of linear search in the worst case?
Which search algorithm works only on sorted arrays?
What is the time complexity of binary search in the worst case?

modules.title: Advanced Sorting and Searching Techniques
modules.content: Understand advanced algorithms like Heap Sort and Interpolation Search and their applications.

questions.question: Which sorting algorithm uses a binary heap data structure?
What is the average-case time complexity of Interpolation Search?
Which data structure is used in Heap Sort?
Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
What is the space complexity of Merge Sort?
Which sorting algorithm is the most efficient for small datasets?
What is the best-case time complexity of Quick Sort?
In which case does Quick Sort perform the worst?
options: When the pivot is always the smallest or largest element
When the pivot is the middle element
When the pivot is chosen randomly
questions.correctAnswer: When the pivot is always the smallest or largest element

questions.question: What is the time complexity of Binary Search in the average case?
What is the best-case time complexity of Linear Search?
Which algorithm divides the search space into three parts instead of two?
Which sorting algorithm is not based on comparisons?
What is the time complexity of Heap Sort in all cases?

modules.title: Introduction to Dynamic Programming
modules.content: Learn the basics of dynamic programming (DP), its characteristics, and the concept of overlapping subproblems and optimal substructure.

questions.question: What is the primary feature of dynamic programming?
Which of the following problems is best solved using dynamic programming?
What is memoization in dynamic programming?
options: Storing intermediate results to avoid recalculations
Breaking a problem into independent subproblems
Choosing the best possible solution at each step
questions.correctAnswer: Storing intermediate results to avoid recalculations

modules.title: Greedy Algorithms and Their Applications
modules.content: Explore greedy algorithms, their characteristics, and applications in problems like Huffman coding and Kruskal's algorithm.

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms follows a greedy approach?
In which type of problem is the greedy algorithm guaranteed to give an optimal solution?
options: Problems with optimal substructure and greedy choice property
questions.correctAnswer: Problems with optimal substructure and greedy choice property

questions.question: Which of the following is an application of greedy algorithms?

modules.title: Famous Dynamic Programming Problems
modules.content: Learn to solve well-known dynamic programming problems such as Longest Common Subsequence, Matrix Chain Multiplication, and Knapsack Problem.

questions.question: Which of the following problems can be solved using dynamic programming?
What is the time complexity of solving the Longest Common Subsequence (LCS) problem using dynamic programming?
Which problem requires building a table to store results of overlapping subproblems?

modules.title: Comparison of Dynamic Programming and Greedy Algorithms
modules.content: Understand the differences between dynamic programming and greedy algorithms and when to choose one over the other.

questions.question: Which technique ensures an optimal solution by solving subproblems once?
Which algorithm picks the best possible choice at each step?
Which of the following is true about dynamic programming?
options: It only works for problems with no overlapping subproblems
It avoids solving the same subproblem multiple times
It always guarantees the shortest path
questions.correctAnswer: It avoids solving the same subproblem multiple times

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a problem solved using dynamic programming?
What is the time complexity of dynamic programming in the Knapsack Problem?
Which algorithm is used in Huffman coding?
Which technique stores intermediate results to optimize performance?
Which of the following problems is solved by a greedy algorithm?
What is the time complexity of Dijkstra's algorithm using a priority queue?
Which data structure is commonly used in dynamic programming?
Which algorithm is used to find the minimum spanning tree of a graph?
What is the key characteristic of greedy algorithms?
options: Choosing the best possible option at each step
Dividing the problem into smaller parts
questions.correctAnswer: Choosing the best possible option at each step

questions.question: Which algorithm solves the shortest path problem for graphs with negative weights?
